keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Ashton B. Carter’s tour sent a message that Americans would work with allies to counter Beijing’s expanding presence, but China may feel a need to speed up its own military buildup.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Lays Marker Down in Challenging Beijing
headline.main: In South China Sea Visit, U.S. Defense Chief Flexes Military Muscle

snippet: Ashton B. Carter’s tour sent a message that Americans would work with allies to counter Beijing’s expanding presence, but China may feel a need to speed up its own military buildup.
abstract: News Analysis; Defense Sec Ashton B Carter solidified military agreements and indicated United States' intention to counter China's spreading influence during six-day visit to India and Philippines; increasingly muscular approach to region may prompt China to accelerate its own military buildup.
